results.title: Expert Sales Closer
results.description:
About Us:

Simour Interior Design proudly serves clients nationwide. Our designs incorporate beauty and provide comfort, functionality, and flow while representing our client's brand story. We combine the art and science of design to consistently create exceptional, custom spaces.

We create medical offices and spaces that serve as a physical reminder of our clients' noble purpose. As a leader in their field, healing is both their passion and their purpose. Not only should their medical office and space be beautiful, but it should be healing for them, their patients, and their staff. Our designs go beyond beauty to provide comfort, functionality, and flow while representing their brand story. This is how we create spaces that are truly healing.

Job Summary:

We are looking for an EXPERT Sales Closer whose key role is to close sales deals with clients and who is passionate about client service.

We serve high caliber clients and our services are in the 5-6 figure price point.

Your duties are to follow incoming sales leads, discuss terms with potential qualified clients, and sign a contract with a high level of expertise. You will work closely with the sales & marketing teams to address short- and long-term sales goals and strategies. Attend weekly meetings to report the process of sales quotas & sales scorecards.

This is a sophisticated and high level sales position that requires expertise to close which results in generating high income for you. This is a 1099 contract position and will be primarily commission based with a monthly base rate of $2,500-$2,800 for FT employees.

 

Requirements

Responsibilities & Duties:

Sales

  1. Management
    • Conduct Pre-Qualification Leads from incoming calls and google
    • Schedule Sales calls with prospects on Zoom
    • Assist with the information for proposal creation and debrief to team
    • Maintain updated leads and deal information in our CRM (Hubspot).
    • Coordinate with marketing on lead generation
    • Meet monthly sales quotes & follow sales scorecard
  2. Offering services
    • Build and maintain relationships with new and current prospects through the communication channels provided by us
    • Conduct Zoom video calls, phone calls with leads and prospects assigned by us
    • Close & Sell the company's services to the qualified prospects, ensuring client is satisfied with the sale, and ask for referrals
    • Negotiate contracts and packages
    • Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on company services
    • Attend webinars, virtual conferences, and meetings
  3. Others
    • Participate in weekly meetings and scheduled calls (Pacific/Central time zones)
    • Develop training programs (as assigned by management team)
    • Undergo training for skill development (subject to management approval.
    • Exceeding Sales Quota
      • Receive 9% commission on agreements closed over the monthly sales quota

results.title: Enterprise, Account Executive
results.description:
As part of our Enterprise Growth team at Turquoise Health, you will be the face of the company and directly responsible for sales and expansion in the segment. You will own the full sales cycle – building relationships with executive stakeholders, designing solutions, managing negotiations, and finalizing contracts with the largest companies in healthcare.

We need a hardworking, curious, entrepreneurial self-starter looking to change how we pay for healthcare and ready to bring a new product to market.

Below is a list of ideal qualifications for this position. Don't meet every single one of them? That's okay! Studies show that BIPOC, people with disabilities, and LGBTQIA+ folks hesitate to apply for a position unless they meet 100% of the qualifications listed. We encourage anyone to apply for all open roles. Building a truly diverse team is a challenge that we do not shy away from. Healthcare affects all people differently, but it significantly affects those in underserved communities. With a robust, diverse team, we are stronger and better equipped to change the future of healthcare for all.

Requirements

Most of the time:

  • Identify new sales enterprise opportunities and develop them into high-value opportunities to fuel our growth at Turquoise Health
  • Build relationships and establish communications at the highest executive levels to understand their needs and priorities and to speed up and simplify the deal process
  • Own the closing process, including negotiations and procurement activities
  • Collaborate and share customer feedback with Product to identify new offerings to continuously increase the value of Turquoise Health
  • Diligently update Salesforce, our CRM, so we can learn more about our business and customers

What you bring to the role:

  • 5+ years of sales and/or business development experience at a technology or management consulting company with consistent attainment or out-performance of sales goals
  • Successful track record of developing high-profile, long-term business relationships with executive stakeholders
  • Domain expertise of the healthcare system in the United States and a curiosity to keep learning the intricacies and changes within the industry is a plus
  • Ability to make thoughtful, actionable recommendations and quickly build consensus with senior-level internal and external stakeholders
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience/knowledge. We are happy to work with strong candidates with non-traditional educational backgrounds

Benefits

  • Competitive pay with equity options
  • Stellar health care plan options (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 401K + 4% Matching
  • Fully remote + $750 WFH stipend + paid quarterly remote co-working weeks
  • Monthly health and wellness benefit
  • Generous family leave
  • Annual $1200 Learning & Development Benefit

 

About Turquoise Health

At Turquoise, we're making healthcare pricing simpler, more transparent, and lower cost for everyone. Have you or a family member ever gotten an MRI, a lab, or even a straightforward surgery without knowing the cost in advance? That's bonkers, right? We're working to fix that.

We're a Series A startup backed by top VCs a16z, Box Group, Bessemer Venture Partners, and Tiger Global. Most importantly, we're an accomplished group of folks (moonlighting as authors, bass players, improv instructors, chefs, linguists, and trivia buffs) with a passion for improving healthcare. We're eager to find ambitious and well-rounded teammates to join us on this mission.

Job Location

Turquoise Health is a fully remote company based in the US. We operate during US business hours and work with clients based in the US.

results.title: Sales Representative
results.description:
Description

Have a passion for fitness & Welness and a talent for sales? So why not do both?

At Arbox, we live and breathe health and wellness, providing a management software solution for small business owners

Our Saas product has disrupted the Fitness and Wellness industry across 25 countries worldwide with a hyper-growing amount of 1MM end users.

We have successfully penetrated various markets around the globe looking to expand into the Spanish\ Portuguese market

We are looking for a Freelance Account Manager to help develop and accelerate our growth in the European market!



About Us:

Our mission is to help small to medium owners transform from industry experts to business experts. Using Arbox allows our customers to simultaneously grow their businesses while focusing on doing what they do best – building their community and making their clients feel happy and fulfilled.

Arbox has an energized, innovative, fun, and supportive culture. We look for positive, friendly, creative, and dynamic people with a passion to succeed and join this amazing journey!



What your Arbox day will look like:

  • Managing prospective client relationships through all phases of the sales cycle 
  • Developing and maintaining prospect and customer lists based on strategic marketing data and other sources for sales leads
  • Schedule appointments and book demonstrations
  • Perform product demos using web tools to prospects and customers
  • Coordinating the sales team by managing schedules, coordinating meetings, filing important documents, and communicating relevant information.
  • Build a strong pipeline of prospects by sourcing potential leads.
  • Achieve and exceed monthly KPI’s and quota
Requirements

So what do we offer?

  • High commission and bonus packages
  • Work in a flexible, fast-paced global environment
  • Massive impact and room for personal growth
  • Combining your passions :)
  • If this is interesting please go to our website or send your resume to yael@arboxapp.com

results.title: SEO Sales Manager
results.description:
Hi! We're LinkGraph, an SEO software company (and full-service digital agency) focused on engineering products and services that help websites improve their performance on Google. We are a rapidly growing organization with clients from Fortune 500 companies to leading Silicon Valley tech startups, and we're looking to bring on an SEO Sales Manager to help us propel our growth.

Check out our careers page here: https://linkgraph.io/careers/. If you're smart, ambitious, and passionate about working for a tech company, we want to hear from you!

Requirements:

  • MANDATORY - SEO Knowledge and Sales experience.
  • Familiarity using SEO tools like Semrush, Ahrefs and Screaming Frog.
  • Ability to convey technical concepts in a clear way to our clients.
  • Extremely comfortable with technology.
  • Committed to technical excellence.
  • Strong communications skills with ability to adjust selling pitch as needed.
  • Someone looking for a fast-paced startup culture to grow in.

Daily Responsibilities

  • Transition leads from demo to closing deals. You will be in charge of meeting with potential clients, walking them through our services & software, and closing
  • Run live diagnostics of clients' websites and identify areas of opportunity.
  • Setup client sprints and create transition plans for the Success Team.
  • Hybrid of sales and consulting needs for our clients.
  • Provide high level strategic direction, coaching, and driving business results.
  • Adapting in the role as needed.

Life at LinkGraph:

At LinkGraph, we are committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class services and software. From community volunteer days, socially conscious initiatives, and team lunches and outings, our office reflects our team's diverse interests.

We're a growing team of diverse professionals, however, we all share the same goals: to be a part of a company that's on the edge of digital marketing, to make the world a better place, and to have fun doing it. Our team culture is one of fast-paced innovation, where each person is empowered to take on their own ambitious projects, with the support of their teammates. We've got plenty of perks, but the biggest one is working with other energetic high-achievers.

We are very proud of the kind, inclusive, and collaborative company culture we have built and have been very lucky to be recognized by both national and local industry leaders:

  • 2022 Inc. 5000 List of the Fastest-Growing Companies in America
  • Nevada's Top Workplaces - #1 Small Business (Under 150 Employees), Best New Ideas
  • Best Start-Up Agency (U.S. Search Awards)
  • Top B2B Companies (Clutch)
  • Inc's On The Rise and Best Places to Work (Inc. Magazine)
  • Great Place to Work Certified (Great Place to Work)

Benefits:

  • Huge focus on charitable giving (this is LinkGraph's driving force)
  • Fully covered health, vision, and dental insurance
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Personal development budget
  • Lasik eye surgery benefit (Yup, we'll pay for you to have perfect vision!)
  • Pet health insurance (2 pets per employee)
  • Kindness budget (money to spend on your colleagues)
  • Remote work flexibility.
  • You'll be working for a relatively new company that has grown at a speed much faster than competitors over the past two years. Our focus is on building the best team of people, the best products, and the best company overall.

Salary:

$80-140k OTE

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
WHO WE ARE

WATSON CREATIVE is a design-driven business consulting firm based in Portland, Oregon. Our portfolio includes top-tier firms, athletic organizations, and cultural icons. We're designers, writers, parents, mentors, musicians, marketers, volunteers, programmers, filmmakers, MBAs, and dreamers. For us, design is a passion, a sport, and an obsession.

WHO WE WANT

You are an Account Manager responsible for developing and managing client relationships. Your focus is being a strategic partner to the client, acting as a “Fractional CMO” for their business. Understanding client needs, defining solutions, and advocating for the client and brand during the creative process are all part of your responsibility. 

YOUR MISSION

You will deliver premium business solutions on time and on the budget for the agency requiring the ability to work effectively with team members and clients alike. As a team leader and strategist, the Account Manager must maintain the long-term vision for each account in partnership with the Creative Director. You will own and drive the client relationship through every phase of work, and be responsible for long-term efficiency, profitability, and growth targets. 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Shepherd multiple cross-disciplinary projects through the agency at one time.
  • Act as a strategic advisor to clients, understanding their business, goals, and metrics; craft agency solutions to meet those targets.
  • Partner with Project Managers to craft SOWs including hours, hard costs, invoicing schedules, deliverables, and timelines.
  • Collaborate with Creative Leads to ensure deliverables are on brand and meet client expectations.
  • Coordinate with our CEO to respond to incoming leads and vet opportunities
  • Work with the COO to forecast quarterly and annual revenue.
  • Upsell and cross-sell existing clients on additional programs 
  • Champion account management best practices across the studio
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS 
  • Five + years of creative agency experience.
  • Demonstrated understanding of marketing and advertising campaigns, including strategy, branding, digital, and media components.
  • Ability to lead a team with a strong focus on collaboration while managing shifting priorities.
  • Extensive client-facing exposure; comfortable leading meetings. 
  • Strong organization, personal presentation skills, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and fast-paced, informal environments.
  • Excellent written and spoken communicator
  • Ability to manage design staff with patience and empathy
  • Solid and well-developed sense of integrity in alignment with our core values
  • Bachelor's Degree in Design, Advertising, or Marketing may substitute for three years of the required experience

BENEFITS & PERKS
  • Health Care Plan, plus additional budget for custom insurance options
  • Term Life insurance 
  • 401k matching plan 
  • Maternity/paternity leave
  • Paid Vacation, Holidays, and the week after Christmas off.
  • Flexible schedules & Remote working welcomed
  • And more

results.title: VP of Sales
results.description:
Accelerating the Web3 transformation journey

Blockchain application development is hard.

Fewer than 1% of developers have experience with this technology but it is increasingly clear that everyone on the planet will be positively impacted in the coming years by blockchain, as meaningful applications are built and adoption increases.

SettleMint is here to make blockchain application development easy for developers, by providing the best high-performance low-code platform for blockchain application development for enterprise and public sector.

We abstract away complexity so developers can devote their time and efforts to building game-changing solutions for a better tomorrow.

 

We are a venture-funded global scale-up, and we recently closed our series-A funding of €16 million, co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. We reached a new phase of growth and are now expanding our commercial teams with clients in financial services, retail, manufacturing, and public institutions with offices in Europe (Belgium), MEA (Dubai), India (Delhi), and APAC (Singapore). Our Japan office is opening this quarter. We work closely with our growing network of partners in all regions enabling them to rapidly deliver solutions to their clients.

 

We are a remote-first company, we work async (so you can focus on the actual work) and we empower our team members to take ownership of their work. We hire the best talents in the blockchain space and we trust their ability to do a great work to support the growth of the company.

Skills, values alignment, and cultural fit are equally important to us, as they will enable top-performing team members to rapidly grow their careers with us.

For this role, we require candidates to be based in Japan.

 

If this sounds exciting to you, we are looking forward to hearing from you and reviewing your candidacy for this role!

 

The role

As a VP sales, you are responsible for building a scalable sales machine in your region (Japan).

Your work focuses on building direct and indirect sales teams. You confidently share product and service information with outside prospects and partners. You will have full responsibility for all demand and revenue generation including inbound and outbound sales efforts and building strong commercial relationships with our implementation partners in your region. You will need to scale your team (MDR, SDRs, Partner executives, Partner account managers, etc.) in your region. You’ll work closely with the marketing department and the customer success team taking end-to-end ownership of your region's sales strategy.


Responsibilities

 

  • Achieve the revenue target assigned to your region

  • Manage the daily sales operations in your region

  • Report directly to the CRO

  • Responsible for aggressive commercial expansion in your region working closely with existing integration partners

  • Handle change management and apply commercial processes designed by CRO

  • Acquire new corporate clients and partners in your region

  • Recruit sales talent in collaboration with the Recruitment team, onboard them, and develop future sales leaders

  • Create a performance-oriented culture that enables SettleMint to become the leading High-Performance Low-Code Blockchain in your region

  • Build relationships with external influencers, stakeholders and decision-makers

  • Develop and maintain a strong pipeline of new sales opportunities

  • Manage, coach, and motivate people in a fast-growing sales team to improve their performance and prepare them for future roles

  • Execute inbound and outbound sales processes to optimize repeatable and scalable growth

  • Ensure appropriate use of company sales playbook: outreach cadences, sales materials, CRM processes etc.

  • Define and execute go-to-market strategies for your region

  • Monitor team activity through tools and dashboards to measure and achieve KPI's

 

 

What we are looking for

Must have

 

 

  • Proven leadership skills in building a performing sales team in your region (Japan)

  • Experience in recruiting and training new team members and development of future sales leaders

  • Proven track record of exceeding commercial targets

  • Analytical Mindset and hands-on attitude: you will develop a scalable sales machine using a structured methodology

  • Organizational skills are key

  • Ambitious: This is a position for somebody who embraces an aggressive growth curve

  • Extremely curious, hardworking, and eager to learn

  • 7+ years of relevant sales experience and a successful track record in a high-growth B2B SaaS company

  • Proficient networking skills

  • Strong understanding of blockchain applications beyond cryptocurrency

 

Nice to have

  • Experience working with blockchain technology

 

Benefits of working at SettleMint

  • Be part of the Blockchain / WEB3 revolution
  • Dynamic but stable scale-up, with the mission to make blockchain accessible for all
  • A fun team to be in, with high standards and a culture of transparency and collaboration
  • Attractive salary package
  • Commission based on performance
  • Flexible working hours, location, and async work environment
  • Clear targets and clear rewards when you crush them
  • Global colleagues who are passionate, hardworking and smart, just like you!
  • Constant training and coaching on both Blockchain Technology and Sales
  • A fast-growing team that is fired up and passionate about what we do because, well, it is bloody important
  • We care about your growth and development and promote lateral and vertical career progression
Application process:
  • Resume screening
  • 1st Interview: Recruiter
  • 2nd Interview: Hiring Manager (CEO)
  • Take-home assessment
  • 3rd Interview: assessment review and presentation
  • 4th Interview: VP of Finance 
  • Reference check
  • Offer
 
Inclusivity and belonging.

SettleMint is inclusive for everyone, and is for anyone.

We encourage candidates from all ethnic, gender, sexual, age, and abilities groups to apply and be part of our company.

We are a very diverse team, and we want to continue our efforts in hiring and retaining the most diverse talents from all over the world.

SettleMint is a remote-first company, with our work culture and company policies centered around remote work. Operating from various locations around the globe, with offices in Leuven (Europe), Dubai (UEA/MEA), Singapore (APAC), Tokyo and Delhi (India), employees are linked to their nearest regional office but are empowered to work remotely, in the office or anything in-between that they find most comfortable.

We believe in offering employees a flexible workspace to create a happy, productive, diverse and inclusive team.

results.title: VP, Sales
results.description:
Company Description

VIVIO Health is on a mission to help make data the basis for clinical decision-making. VIVIO’s evidence-based, data-driven specialty drug management and cost control solution has improved healthcare outcomes and lowered costs for large self-insured employers since 2016. 
About You:

You are looking to drive change in healthcare. As our VP of Sales, you will own the primary responsibility for new customer acquisition. You will represent VIVIO in the marketplace by establishing trusted relationships with channel partners and self-funded employers. You will have direct responsibility for initiating opportunities, presenting the VIVIO value proposition, responding to RFPs, and securing new customers. You already have a great reputation for being able to manage through complexity and challenges with the utmost integrity. You work quickly to understand the needs and preferences of the many people with whom you interact and intuitively treat each individual as they want to be treated. Micromanagement is not the VIVIO style. We are only interested in team members that are reliable, committed, and comfortable in a remote working environment. If you are a problem solver, enjoy working with different personality types, and are internally motivated to compete in a challenging market, you will love being on this team.

Who You Will Be Working With:

VIVIO views sales as everyone’s responsibility. You will work closely with the following teams: Clinical and Science, Product Development, Data Analytics, Member Experience, and Customer Success. You will report directly to VIVIO’s Chief Growth Officer.



Job Description

What You Will Be Doing:

• As VIVIO’s first sales professional, we are looking for an individual to work together with the Chief Growth Officer to develop, and implement, a sales strategy.

• The VP of Sales will balance prioritizing opportunities for long-term success with short-term revenue expectations.

• You will be charged with deepening VIVIO’s existing relationships across national, regional and boutique employee benefits brokerage and consulting firms.

• You will develop a list of direct to employer prospects and develop those relationships.

• You will adapt your sales strategy, as necessary, to ensure success.

• As an innovator in the specialty drug market, VIVIO is not looking to only respond to RFPs. Instead, we are looking to partner with stakeholders that understand our model and place us in opportunities where we can add the most value.



Qualifications

The Experience and Characteristics You Will Need (Required):

• 10+years of professional experience, including 5+ of direct employee benefits or pharmacy benefit sales experience with self-funded employers or health plans.

• Impeccable presentation and communication skills.

• Working experience in a HIPAA-compliant environment.

• Strong aptitude for complex products and solutions.

• Mission-driven, highly motivated to drive impact in healthcare.

• Highly empathetic.

• Genuine interest in helping others.

• Travel as needed.

The Experience We Prefer:

• Working knowledge of pharmacy benefits, PBMs, and specialty drugs.

• Pharmacy degree and accreditation.

• Technical acumen required to work with data.

• Experience in entrepreneurial environments.



Additional Information

VIVIO Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of any status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local municipal law. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Regular Full-Time Role with Benefits

results.title: Account Coordinator, AdSuite
results.description:
Account Coordinator, AdSuite

Overview:

The Account Coordinator provides administrative support to the AdSuite sales team, composed of Sales and Account Management personnel, by supporting critical business administration activities and collaborating with internal departments to keep the business operating efficiently and effectively in service to our customers. The position requires handling multiple tasks under deadlines, excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, and solid communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills.

In this role, you will leverage your sales administration skills to support the team with critical administrative duties, including but not limited to advertising campaign activation and coordination, Salesforce data entry and maintenance, administration of any related end platform, and collection and compilation of reporting and performance data. The Account Coordinator will support team members and coordinate sales-related activities but is not responsible for selling products.

This role is an exciting opportunity to support our largest market while growing your career with a growing team and organization.

The impact you'll make:

  • Support media plan administration, e.g., asset collection 
  • Support listing admin tasks and client request
  • Gather and deliver on reporting requirements and data requests provided by Sales & CS team members. Audit and maintain Salesforce records to ensure they are correct and up to date
  • Collaborate with other departments to facilitate essential functions like billing, licensing, listing maintenance, etc.
  • Develop and maintain organized trackers and documentation to provide shared transparency and updates on the status and completion of critical initiatives and projects
  • Assist with large-scale account activations
  • Attend client meetings and strategic sessions to ensure alignment on account growth plans

What you've accomplished:

  • Bachelor's Degree preferred in Business Administration or a related field
  • 1-2 or more years of professional experience in digital media/advertising
  • Strong administrative, organizational, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication, sales, and customer service skills
  • The ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment, and meet deadlines
  • Develop and maintain a working knowledge of industry trends and regulations

Bonus Points:

  • Proficiency with Excel and/or Google Sheets
  • Strong working knowledge of Salesforce
  • Experience with analytics and online advertising a plus
  • Experience as a sales coordinator supporting advertising accounts
  • Experience collaborating within a team setting and working cross-functionally

Our 2022 Benefits:

  • Medical, Dental & Vision benefits (effective Day1):
    • Employee - employer paid premium 100%
    • Dependent - employer paid premium 80%
    • HMO - Kaiser & Anthem
    • PPO and HDHP with HSA - Anthem
  • Basic Life & AD&D - employer paid 1x salary
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan (with employer contribution)
  • PTO (3 weeks accrued); 5 sick days
  • Supplemental, voluntary benefits
    • Kindbody (family planning/fertility), including up to $10,000 towards cash-pay services
    • BenefitEd (Student Loan Repayment/529 Education Savings), including a company contribution of up to $1,000/year
    • FSA (Medical, Dependent, Transit, and Parking)
    • Voluntary Life Insurance
    • Critical Illness Insurance
    • Accident Insurance
    • Short- and long-term disability Insurance
    • Pet Insurance
    • Company-paid identity theft protection
    • Rocket Lawyer legal services platform
  • Paid parental leave
  • Reimbursements for home office setup and monthly WiFi

Why Weedmaps?

  • You get to play a meaningful role in the future of cannabis and how it’s regarded globally
  • Catered lunches provided while working in the office
  • Casual work environment, no fancy clothes required, but you are free to dress to the nines!
  • Generous PTO and company holidays
  • Endless opportunities to network and connect with your Weedmappers through education and speaker series, Employee Resource Groups, happy hours, team celebrations, game nights, and much more!

Weedmaps is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Our company uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify.

Applicants may be entitled to reasonable accommodations under the terms of the ADA and state/local laws.  Please inform us if you need assistance participating in the interview process.

About Weedmaps:

WM Technology, Inc.’s (Nasdaq: MAPS) mission is to power a transparent and inclusive global cannabis economy. Now in its second decade, WM Technology has been a driving force behind much of the legislative change we’ve seen in the past 10 years.

Founded in 2008, WM Technology, is a leading technology and software infrastructure provider to the cannabis industry, comprising a B2C platform, Weedmaps, and B2B software, WM Business. The cloud-based SaaS solutions from WM Business provide an end-to-end operating system for cannabis retailers. WM Business’ tools support compliance with the complex, disparate, and constantly evolving regulations applicable to the cannabis industry. Through its website and mobile apps, WM Technology provides consumers with the latest information about cannabis retailers, brands, and products, facilitating product discovery and driving engagement with our retail and brand customers.

WM Technology holds a strong belief in the power of cannabis and the importance of enabling safe, legal access to consumers worldwide. Since inception, WM Technology has worked tirelessly, not only to become the most comprehensive platform for consumers, but to build the software solutions that power businesses compliantly in the space, to advocate for legalization, social equity, and licensing in many jurisdictions, and to facilitate further learning through partnering with subject matter experts on providing detailed, accurate information about the plant.

Headquartered in Irvine, California, WM Technology supports remote work for all eligible employees. Visit us at www.weedmaps.com.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Finexio is the leader in AP Payments as a Service, the leading embedded payments approach for business the business payments. Finexio simplifies the way businesses process and receive B2B payments by integrating electronic payments and cash flow improvement solutions directly into customers’ accounts payable and procurement software.

Our vision is a world in which finance leaders only have to decide “what” to pay- Finexio’s software seamlessly handles the “how” and the “when”.

We are growing 250+% per year and are a leading disruptor in the B2B Payments and Fintech industry. The company has raised over $65m in investment and is backed by investors JP Morgan, Discover, NBH Bank, Mendon Venture Partners, and Valley Bank. These investors believe in the mission and technology so much so they are also customers and partners.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years in a customer-facing, account-management role in the payments industry
  • Track record of successfully managing clients, increasing product adoption, action planning, and fielding escalations
  • Ability to manage several customers and projects simultaneously
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to analyze and manage customer data
  • Positive, can-do attitude combined with an ability to manage customer expectations and be assertive and persuasive
  • Willingness to occasionally work beyond regular office hours when needed; Approximately 25% travel.
  • Ability to cope in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Previous start-up experience a plus.


Specifications

  • Owns the success of the assigned Finexio’s customers including program management, and customer account and relationship management. Expands the existing footprint of solutions within a given customer with a strong focus on Net Revenue Retention.
  • Focuses on retention and addition of revenue opportunities with customers for new solutions, projects, and electronic payments
  • Maintains strong knowledge of the customer portfolio and be able to articulate the primary analytical goals and business imperatives
  • Provides proactive communication both internally and externally to ensure customers’ needs are met
  • Maintains an understanding of customers’ immediate, short, and long- term business needs to protect, retain and increase revenues
  • Provides industry insights and best practices to the assigned customers on a quarterly basis
  • Promotes new Finexio solutions to assigned customers
  • Reviews customers’ volumes and provides customers clients feedback on potential new electronic suppliers with ability to analyze volumes and present to the customer in a concise professional manner
  • Influences the product roadmap based on customer feedback through participation in Product Meetings
  • Contributes to feasibility studies, Statement of Work (SOW) and RFP/RFI responses, certifications, audits, etc.

Benefits

    Why You’ll Love Working at Finexio:

results.description:
Welcome! Super excited you dropped by 🥳

Join our mission to create and connect cyber-ready humans and organizations through highly engaging hacking experiences that cultivate out-of-the-box thinking. (Find out more insights about Hack The Box culture on our career site).


About Hack The Box

Hack The Box is a massive hacking playground, and infosec community of over 1.0m platform members who learn, hack, play, exchange ideas and methodologies. We are an online cybersecurity training platform that allows individuals, businesses, universities, and all kinds of organizations all around the world to level up their offensive and defensive security skills through a fully gamified and engaging learning environment.

Hack The Box has an ambitious mission: to make the world more secure from cybersecurity risks by focusing on the human element. Afterall, cybersecurity relies on people in addition to technology and processes. The human element applies to retaining top cybersecurity talent, upskilling other team members and assessing new talent to ultimately test, measure and improve organizational cyber readiness. Many of the Global 500 companies, cybersecurity technology firms, consulting partnerships, higher education, state and local government and federal agencies from around the globe entrust Hack The Box with the human element of cybersecurity.


About the Role

Hack The Box is looking for a Commercial Account Executive to help us expand our customer base in three fast-growing areas: accounts under $1B in revenue, universities, and state/local agencies. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and business development background that enables them to drive engagement at all levels with technical and non-technical buyers.

As a Commercial Account Executive, you'll be responsible for developing and executing against a comprehensive account/territory plan as well as driving sales to achieve revenue targets. The person in this role will also assist in creating and articulating compelling value propositions for Hack The Box services.


Responsibilities
  • Manage contract negotiations
  • Maintain a robust sales pipeline
  • Develop a growth strategy/territory plan focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction
  • Establish long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
  • Develop a growth strategy/territory plan focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience selling technical solutions or products to the mid-market accounts, universities or state/local agencies
  • Experience managing longer, complex sales cycles
  • Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus)
  • Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment
  • Excellent interpersonal skill for making initial contact, ongoing communication with customers and business associates and company presentations, meetings, etc.
  • Experience in the SaaS market is a must and Cyber Security experience is strongly preferred
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to create, progress and close opportunities with good CRM hygiene and accurate forecasting

Benefits

Why work at Hack The Box?

  • You’ll have the chance to shape the industry of cybersecurity upskillig
  • You'll work on a well-recognised cyber product about which people are excited
  • You’ll be able to grow as we grow and solve challenging problems working with people all over the world
  • You'll work with an international, passionate about HTB and very talented team
  • You’ll definitely have fun while working at HTB 🥳

We have also other benefits that will keep you happy:

  • Private insurance, Dental & Vision, 401K
  • Paid paternity & maternity leave
  • 25 annual leave days
  • Dedicated budget for training and professional development, participation in conferences
  • State-of-the-art equipment
  • Full access to the Hack The Box lab offerings; so you can learn how to hack 😉
  • Flexibility in working hours
